Description:
In this role, the Quality Control (QC) Associate will be part of Wholesale Credit Governance program within the Chase Business Banking (BB) Risk Team to ensure compliance with regulations and Business Banking ( BB) & Firmwide policies/procedures. 
Your role will be a combination of Quality Control of new originations credits, as well as overall portfolio by conducting regular quality reviews. Creation, Distribution and Oversight of multiple Risk Monitoring reports and Oversight on various governance initiatives across Business Banking Risk Team. You are expected to possess a strong credit acumen, experience in reviewing / peer Quality Control and technical background including project management and reporting skills.Responsibilities:Quality Control associated with new originations and portfolio risk underwriting and monitoring activities at underwriter / portfolio level
Quality Control tool (ACES) management and maintenance and Preparing and maintaining Quality Control  procedures
Identifying and highlighting error trend based on Quality Control result and drive training interventions to address the same
Report creation, distribution, and oversight of assigned risk monitoring tools / reports on a periodic basis
Lead governance initiatives across Business Banking to drive consistency across Risk Team
Assist with preparation for internal and external reviews, audits, and examinations
Assist or coordinate projects and process improvementsRequired qualifications, capabilities and skillsMore than 5 years of experience in Credit Underwriting, Risk Quality Control, Audit, Compliance or Risk Management
Knowledge of risk and control assessment process
Demonstrated ability to collaborate cross-functionally to achieve measurable results
Skills & experience to manage targeted portfolios ( e.g. formal credit training, traditional lending products, treasury and cash management product knowledge, problem loan experience)
Bachelor's Degree required with a focus in Accounting, Finance, Business or Economics preferred
Knowledge and experience with data management and reporting tools - Tableau, Alteryx, Excel, SAP preferred
Knowledge and experience with multiple programming languages - Excel, VBA preferredPreferred qualifications, capabilities and skillsStrong analytical skills and the ability to analyze large sets of data preferred
Familiarity with key Financial Institution regulations preferred
MBA or professional certification preferredJPMorgan Chase & Co., one of the oldest financial institutions, offers innovative financial solutions to millions of consumers, small businesses and many of the world’s most prominent corporate, institutional and government clients under the J.P. Morgan and Chase brands.
